newsitem.title: FINLAND: Baltic Ice-Slow melting but restrictions unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Baltic Ice-Slow melting but restrictions unchanged.

text.p: Ice levels continued to ease gradually but all restrictions to navigation were unchanged, the Finnish Institute of Marine Research said in its twice-weekly ice report on Thursday.

Five ice-breakers were assisting in the northern end of the Gulf of Bothnia and one in the middle outside Kokkola and Pietarsaari, the institute said. Four ice-breakers remained in action near St Petersburg in the eastern Gulf of Finland.
PORT TEMP ICE TYPE THICKNESS RESTRICTIONS
St Petersburg n/a Open/ridged 15-30 Russian ice class 13,
Vyborg n/a Fast/ridged 30-40 Russian ice class 13,
Oulu n/a Consolidated/ 50-75 Ice class IA,
Kemi n/a Consolidated/ 50-80 Ice class IA
Lulea n/a Fast/level 30-50 Ice class IA,
Kokkola, n/a Fast/compact/ 40-70 Ice class IA,
Vaasa n/a Fast 10-40 Ice classs IA, IB
NOTES: New ice - forming, thin and still moving. Fast ice - not moving level flat ice. Level ice - thick flat ice.
Consolidated/compact - compact close ice. Rafted - ridges forming, 10-20 cm thick. Ridged - ridged or hummocked ice. Open - floes with water at rate of 4-6:10.
